intro: Aklema xanti, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Aklema xanti is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
